Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: The content taught in class did not always seem to be relevant to the project of redesigning the MyKettering website. It felt like the class should have just focused on one or the other.

Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: I felt as though the course was more of a capstone class, and we were doing more writing of our reports rather than honing in on key areas of HCI and developing those skills further.

Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: The course pivoted half-way through the term into something that I think was different from what most students expected. But in a way this is the most realistic class, as doing custom work for clients and suppliers often times results in goals being shifted and targets are constantly changing.

Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: I felt the course could have included more lectures/case studies to drive home more of the actual interface design

Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: I didn't know what to expect from this class at first. Now that it's over, I can say that I definitely learned about intuitiveness, heuristic, and gestalt principles, but I fail to make the connection to the real world and don't really know how I would use this new knowledge at work besides designing presentations

Question Text: Comments

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: The strengths of this course are learning useful interactive tools and strategies such as low-fidelity prototyping or Figma.

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: Groupwork, hands-on work, and report writing. I really enjoyed the guest lectures at the end of the term.

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: It is an interesting and sometimes overlooked field. I don't know if this was class specific or not, but the guest lecturers at the end were very enjoyable.

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: I think the course does a good job at introducing a more specialized topic to students and expand their potential horizon of interest and growth. Guest lectures made it nice to speak to people who are working in this field and be open to discussion about alternative/non-traditional job roles in the market.

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: Get to see the full timeline of survey, interviews, low-fidelity, and medium fidelity reports in such a way where the project develops overtime to get a meaningful end result

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: Develops teamwork

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: Being able to work in groups makes it so that we can divide the work depending on peoples strengths.

Question Text: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Answer Text: The project

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: Maybe find a way to make it a little less dependent on the group work portion just in case students get stuck with a bad group.

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: Having to work with a random group was not very enjoyable since I believe that I would be able to work better with my group if I had the option to choose them. I also did not enjoy very much having a required team meeting outside of class time each week, since the only time everyone in the group could fit in their schedule was not especially convenient.

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: Smaller, more personal assignments for homework, almost like a case study that is assigned for 2-3 weeks rather than a term-long project.

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: N/A it is very dependant on the client/professor

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: I think the class could be improved by organizing the class's team goals earlier. At the beginning there was the impression that we would all be working on our own prototypes for the KU intranet, and then halfway through the term (or over halfway) we combined as a class to just make 1 prototype. I'm not sure if it was done this way specifically because of figma or not, but it felt like work each team was doing leading up to that point was wasted or went unused. There were things that we couldn't work on because that responsibility when to another group, even though we spent the time to collect data, interview, etc. This class felt like a capstone class, which is not what I was expecting. Although I did enjoy the project, I may have also enjoyed learning additional material through lectures.

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: I think there should be more case studies that are broken up in a way where you are learning about interface/interaction more. I felt the term-long project detracted sometimes from the overall learning outcomes. Additionally, the project did at times feel a bit more like a capstone rather than a regular course project.

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: Too much writing and the class this term depended on things outside of our control (interviews, surveys, etc)

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: Maybe have a server (like Discord or Teams) that allows all the students in the class to have an easy way to communicate with each other about questions. Especially when the course project gets to the point where we are all working on the same online prototype

Question Text: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
Answer Text: While not as much time was needed to be spent outside of class/team meetings, because the project required working with people not in the course, it was difficult at times to stay on track with deadlines. While some weeks the work load was manageable with other classes, there were times where it felt like there was not enough time. Specifically when working on the interviews and paper prototype, along with the analysis.

Question Text: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?
Answer Text: Sometimes, the bi-weekly reports felt more like a chore than they were valuable. I really enjoyed what we learned in the classroom, but the term-long group project was not very enjoyable for me personally.

Question Text: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?
Answer Text: It's group dependent on how much work you really have to do if the same structure is used.

Question Text: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?
Answer Text: If you're interested in this field, looking for a fun project-based course, then go for it.

Question Text: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?
Answer Text: Try to fully utilize the different phases of the project for finding meaningful changes to the end project. If you use Dr. Maier's feedback and lectures within your reports you can make a really great end product which users will appreciate.

Question Text: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?
Answer Text: Be prepared to write a report every other week.

Question Text: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?
Answer Text: Make sure that you are computer proficent and know how to look for resources relevant to the project/subject

Question Text: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?
Answer Text: Make group member expectations clear so that if an issue comes up it can be resolved without severely hindering your project timeline and grade.

Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: Dr. Maier was great all term. Constantly providing feedback that was meaningful to fully grasp all we could out of each report and section of the project. Highly recommend taking a course with him.

Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: Dr. Maier is an amazing lecturer. I enjoy his classes, and he teaches in a way that concepts are digestible and not overcomplicated.

Question Text: Comments
Answer Text: Really kind and flexible professor, he treats his students like the young adults they are and understands that they have lives outside of class and assigns work that makes sure to not take away insane amounts of personal time, but still engages the student.
